item.title: Bin area Dunstall House service road, off Marmont Road. Both ends., 5th January
item.description:
It's the same every day. Bins overflowing, rubbish and flytipping everyday. People urinating around and in the mess. The other end is just the same and often worse with flytipping. The pools of urine and smell, especially in the summer is awful. There are rats running through the rubbish. It's worse when the binmen have been, they leave the rubbish all over the road. A huge thanks to the same man who diligently cleans these area everyday. Wading through pools of urine, open rubbish bags and who know what else. He does a fantastic job daily. The bin collection days have been increased, but not enough. Two bins is not enough for a block of flats. Please do something about this health hazard and view. Stop the constant urination at back Dunstall house. This has been the same for years and getting worse. Please let the council cleaner know how much we appreciate his work at Dunstall House. Please also let the residents know, throwing rubbish bags from the walkways above is dangerous and unpleasant. They miss the bis and splatter on the floor. Maybe fix the chutes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham High Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black ice on the uphill part of Whitmore Road, 5th January
item.description:
This ice has evidently been there for a few days unwritten. I was riding up the hill on my motorbike ( unaware of the ice) when l hit the black ice and the bike slid from under me. It has damaged my bike badly and injured myself on my back and hip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitmore Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unstable Lantern on Lamppost 2M 34 opposite the old school, 5th January
item.description:
The Lantern is lying at an angle as 2 of the 4 bolts holding it to the post have failed the light itself is still working but it is under a large Willow tree and I feel that it could be a danger if it falls as it on public foot way.
